page.description: Gets the contents of a web page.
page.deprecated: Deprecated This function has been deprecated. HTTP_GET() should be used as a replacement.
page.prototype: Page_Text as C = http_get_page(host as C [,page as C [,port as N]])

argument.name: host
argument.description: The URL of the host computer or page.

argument.name: page
argument.description: Default = the default page of the website. The page to retrieve.

argument.name: port
argument.description: Default = 80. The port of the website.

return.name: Page_Text
return.description: The HTML text of the selected page.

section.description: The HTTP_GET_PAGE() function retrieves returns the full HTML Page including the headers sent by the remote server.
section.note: HTTP_GET_PAGE() is not capable of following redirects or handling error responses from a server.

A HTTP GET is different from a HTTP POST in two significant ways. Some devices may restrict the total length of a URL to 128 characters, which may trim the arguments appended by a GET command. There is no such restriction with POST commands. You may save (bookmark) and refresh URLs formatted through a HTTP GET command. The arguments sent by a HTTP POST command are not saved in a bookmark.
